result.execSummary:
The defendant James Peter Pedersen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

Notice of Completion of Case

8:37 AM Defendant James Peter Pedersen in court.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for James Peter Pedersen. State recites agreement that defendant serve 76 days with credit for 57 days, time served, restitution in amount of $680.92 with remaining balance of $180.92 to be paid. ($500 previously paid in forfeited bail) and pay mandatory court costs. State has complied with Victim's Rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Attorney Hoffman stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.

Court orders 76 days jail with credit for 57 days, time served, remaining restitution to be paid of $180.92 and pay mandatory court costs.
Bail receipt from jail
No contact with Matthew Running.

1:49 PM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James Peter Pedersen appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Ellen Denise Craker appeared by video for James Peter Pedersen. Court calls case. Defendant updates address, provides address of CHUM in Duluth. Court quashes warrant, questions non appearance. Defendant indicates he did not have housing in Duluth and did not have a means to get to court hearing. State asks for $1,000 cash and asks for no contact with Matthew Running. State notes prior FTAs and late court appearances. Notes the involuntary appearance over 2 months after missed court date. Was previously out of $500 cash in the matter. Defendant is currently on felony probation in this county and is on absconder status. Craker indicates that the amount of cash is not necessary and notes defendant has nothing he can post. Defendant indicates that he has been in contact with probation and hold as been dropped. Court cites prior minutes from initial appearance in this case and indicates concern over missed appearances in this case and in MN. Court notes that defendant was able to post $500 previously in the file and is concerned over absconder status. Court orders $1,000 cash. No contact with Matthew Running.
Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
